definitions.definition: A mechanism which can be used to hold a note, as the right pedal on a piano.
To maintain, or keep in existence.
definitions.example: The city came under sustained attack by enemy forces.

definitions.definition: To experience or suffer (an injury, etc.).
definitions.example: The building sustained major damage in the earthquake.

definitions.definition: To confirm, prove, or corroborate; to uphold.
definitions.example: to sustain a charge, an accusation, or a proposition

definitions.definition: To keep from falling; to bear; to uphold; to support.
definitions.example: A foundation sustains the superstructure; an animal sustains a load; a rope sustains a weight.

definitions.definition: To aid, comfort, or relieve; to vindicate.
